revised_title: Interference Phenomena in Electric Waves Passing through Different Thicknesses of Electrolyte
tldr: The author investigates interference phenomena in electric waves passing through different thicknesses of electrolytes, discovering that the intensity of the transmitted ray does not steadily decrease, and that transmission follows the same general law as for light with a thin plate. The wave-lengths in air and water are determined, leading to the calculation of the coefficient of refraction and the dielectric constant.
